intro: Microlicia subulata, commonly known as the slender microlicia, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, needle-like leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
